title: WCAS MATH 230-0-31 Differential Calculus of Multivariable Functions

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Vector algebra, vector functions, partial derivatives, optimization, Lagrange multipliers. Students may not receive credit for both 230 and 281-1, 285-2, 290-2, or 291-2. Prerequisite: 214 or 224.

THIS COURSE HAS MANDATORY EVENING MIDTERM EXAMINATIONS. PLEASE CHECK THE REGISTRAR'S WEBPAGE FOR DETAILS: http://www.registrar.northwestern.edu/registration/midterms.html

This exam takes precedence over scheduled meetings of other classes, including labs and discussion sections, held at this time, and it is up to the student to make arrangements for handling conflicts arising from such meetings. In special circumstances, arrangements for dealing with other unavoidable conflicts can be made by alerting the course coordinator at least two weeks ahead of time; he/she will decide if your conflict can be accommodated.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Write coherent and logical solutions to mathematical problems.

Demonstrate problem-solving skills, by analyzing a problem, hypothesizing the outcome, and applying the techniques learned in class to solve the problem.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture and discussion sections meet three times a week. Classes are accompanied by discussion sections, which meet one day a week for problem solving and discussion under the supervision of a teaching assistant.
